Package in.Kaulk.NetLib

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • in.Kaulk.NetLib.Server
  • public final class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    The container and handler for multiple clients

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void doOnDisconnect​(ServerAction a)
      Define a ServerAction (FunctionalInterface) to act on each client that disconnects
      void doToEachClient​(ServerAction a)
      Define a ServerAction (FunctionalInterface) which will act on each client in a separate thread
      void doToNewClients​(ServerAction a)
      Define a ServerAction (FunctionalInterface) to act on every client that joins
      void feedLoggingEvent​(Event e)
      Used to pass events to the logger To create your own event types, create a class that extends Event (The message instance variable is what ends up being written into the log file)
      int getClientAmount()
      Accessor for the current number of connected clients
      Client[] getClients()
      Thread safe method for getting the current list of clients Note: Since clients may be added or removed after the array is returned, It is possible that some of the contents of the array may become unsafe references
      LoggingMode getLoggingMode()
      Accessor for the logging mode of the server
      (package private) void pushClient​(Client c)
      Adds a new Client
      (package private) void remove​(Client c)
      Remove an existing client The client that is will become an unsafe reference
      (package private) void sendToAll​(Message m)
      Send a single message to all connected clients
      void setLoggerMaxEventstackSize​(int max)
      Change the size of the eventstack on the server's logger (Usually the default 64 events should be more than enough)
      void setLoggingMode​(LoggingMode lm)
      Change the logging mode of a logger Args passed to ServerLogger#setMode(LoggingMode l)
      void setupLogger​(java.io.File file, LoggingMode lm)
      Setup a logger for the server Args are passed to ServerLogger constructor
      void startAcceptingClients()
      Starts or re-starts the thread that accepts new clients
      void stopAcceptingClients()
      Stops the thread that accepts new clients

      • Server

        public Server​(int port,
              int maxClients)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        port - defines the port to which the server's socket will be bound
        maxClients - defines the maximum number of clients that can be connected to the server at one time

        Parameters:
        port - port to bind to
        maxClients - maximum number of clients to connect at one time
        hardcoded - the hardcoded public key

      • getClients

        public Client[] getClients()
        Thread safe method for getting the current list of clients Note: Since clients may be added or removed after the array is returned, It is possible that some of the contents of the array may become unsafe references
        Returns:
        the currently connected clients
        See Also:
        remove(Client c)

        Returns:
        number of connected clients

      • feedLoggingEvent

        public void feedLoggingEvent​(Event e)
        Used to pass events to the logger To create your own event types, create a class that extends Event (The message instance variable is what ends up being written into the log file)
        Parameters:
        e - new event type
        See Also:
        Event, ServerLogger

      • setLoggerMaxEventstackSize

        public void setLoggerMaxEventstackSize​(int max)
        Change the size of the eventstack on the server's logger (Usually the default 64 events should be more than enough)
        Parameters:
        max - new max amount of event objects to be held in a stack for the logger at any given time, before they are popped
        See Also:
        ServerLogger, EventstackOverflowException, Event
